Reviews.Content: Like all items on Amazon, you should read all reviews with the understanding that people are different, and have different expectations, and often give different reviews ie the lady that bought the camera wanting zoom during video (which is actually a rare feature in a camera less than $300), but didn't verify that before she bought the camera and then gave it 2 stars (not fair).  People also act as if nothing ships from factories without defects which is a very unrealistic point of view.My camera worked flawlessly right out of the box.  The battery had enough power for me to take two gorgeous shots of our twins, and I was very impressed with the lcd screen view and even more amazed that it was the same image once transfered to pc.  Once the battery was charged I took some really good video with none of the noise problems listed by other users.  Connecting it directly to the tv through hdmi worked very well.  This is a good point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: What a Great Little Camera!!
Reviews.Author: J. Mclean
Reviews.Content: I was so frustrated with other "point-&-shoot" cameras I had tried...the lag time for the camera to focus and shoot was SO LONG I usually missed the shot I was trying to get.  After researching specifically for shutter speeds, this camera caught my eye...a Nikon, great reviews on the shutter speed issue, not too expensive.  I was not looking for the expense of the SLR family of cameras and wanted something small so I would carry it with me in my purse (no extra camera bag to lug around).  This camera has met or exceeded every one of my expectations.  Clarity of pictures is terrific, nothing but high marks for ease of use and size/weight measurements.  I LOVE this camera and highly recommend it to the casual point-&-shoot photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot for price
Reviews.Author: Mom22boys
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my Kodak Point and Shoot broke (after I *oops* dropped it)  I picked the Nikon Coolpix S8000 for the huge viewfinder and the 14 mp.So far I am very happy with this camera.  I have taken pictures using a lot of the different settings.  The food, close-up, landscape and panoramic assistant are all great.  The auto mode is great too.  I wish it had some kind of kid or action photo setting so I could take better pictures of my kids playing - my kodak camera had one and I miss it.My only other complaint is the flash is at a very inconvienent place.  It is right where you would typically rest your finger on top of the camera and if you have your finger there the flash won't pop up.It has great battery life, and is nice and slim to slip into your pocket or purse.I am overall very pleased with this camera!****After owning this camera for a while I am not a huge fan of it.  I don't like the delay between pressing the button and the picture actually taking.  My battery life is also shot.  I still love the bronze color and the size of the camera.  I have gotten used to the position of the flash, but still think it is in a horrible position (what were they thinking?)I probably wouldn't buy this camera a second time.  Wish I could find the perfect point and shoot that acted like a SLR

Reviews.Title: Great Pix - Poor Design
Reviews.Author: James E. Palmiter "Bargin Hunter"
Reviews.Content: I rarely buy anything as soon as it is out but I made an exception with this camera...Mistake...The flash on the camera is just where you tend to put your finger to hold the camera. It has to Pop-Up to work and your finger is exactly where the flash is. The camera does take exceptional pictures but the fact that they have done away with the view finder and the serious design flaw concerning the flash leads me to recommend you do not purchase this model until these things are addressed.Jim PalmiterMacon GA

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix S8000 for my technology challenged wife to take on a trip with one of her girl friends.  It is very easy to operate and takes great pictures under all lighting conditions.  I really like the small size of the camera and the 10x optical zoom is a big plus.  This is our fifth or sixth digital camera and is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Patricia M Brown
Reviews.Content: I found the camera takes a nice picture, but it is very slow to respond. It is slow I actually missed photo opportunities while waiting for it to decide to turn on. We take tons of action shots and use the sequence shooting.  this camera would stop after, say, 20 shots!  It has fewer shooting modes than I am used to having with the Casio and my older Nikon.I'm not going to return it, but won't recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Espinoza
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great. I love it. It takes clear, crisp pictures, and the zoom is great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for point-and-shoot use
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Pevarnek
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S8000 is the first Nikon camera I have owned and I am most definitely impressed.  The image stabilization is amazing along with many of the other features in the camera.  Almost all pictures come out amazing so I really do not have many negative points on this camera.  The one thing I do wish the camera had is more customizable settings (mostly shutter speed).  The only thing that is manually adjustable is ISO and even that is a pain to adjust from the menu.  Overall though, it is an amazing camera and highly recommended for anyone who can live without controlling every setting manually.

Reviews.Title: Good cameral but video issue caused me to return it
Reviews.Author: Tom Cat "cool GPS"
Reviews.Content: Ok, I really like the pictures that this camera produces.  I did decide to return the camera because mine has the audio problem such that during video recording you hear a ticking sound which just drives me crazy.  If it did not do this, I would have kept the camera because the digital stills are very good.  But, I figure if I wait a few months, they may iron out the video bug.One other thing that I did not like about the camera is that in dim lit rooms, it has a shorter focus range than the ZS7.  I ended up keeping the panasonic zs7 instead.  Now the Nikon S8000 does have a more powerful flash than the ZS7, but I found that the panasonic could focus better in low light.  But, if you lock a focus, the S8000 usually gave me a slightly better picture with less noise because the flash was stronger than the ZS7.Outside, I loved the Nikon as well as the ZS7.  The ZS7 just has more controls than the S8000 to "play with".  Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Quality point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Katie W.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just prior to a business/sightseeing trip, and am extremely pleased.10x optical zoom on a camera in this price range is excellent, and the zoom performs quite well. The picture quality is very good on the highest-quality setting (14MP+, which Nikon denotes as "print quality") - the images produced at this setting are around 6MB apiece.The camera has a special flash mode for nighttime pictures and it does make a huge difference. Pictures taken at night or in a dark location using this mode are much less washed-out and grainy than I am used to. Also included are the fairly standard steadiness correction and red-eye reduction.All in all I am impressed with the camera, especially given the price. It is fairly easy to learn to use, especially if you are like me and only want a point and shoot camera, but does have many options to tweak if you wish.The only downside is that the buttons to switch between modes (picture, video, display) aren't always immediately responsive, and since you enter and exit video mode with a button on the back of the camera the last second of video is shaky unless you have a very steady hand.

Reviews.Title: Amazing power in a compact camera!
Reviews.Author: I. Gardner "avid occasional reader"
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable camera!Shot HD video of my brother' graduation and I was sitting across the arena! 10x optical zoom plus a 14.2 megapixel camera in a SLEEK design...WOW!!Buy it!

Reviews.Title: S8000 Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Goldy
Reviews.Content: I thought I had a home run with this camera. Having been a Nikon fan for many years on a professional level I am very disappointed with the physical aspects of the camera. Pictures are great. Screen is great. Didn't use the video so I can't comment on it.First off, I order my camera through Amazon -  THANK GOODNESS!!!!The first two cameras (That's correct; it took three deliveries to get one that worked.) wouldn't charge the battery. That brought up the first short coming : The charger is in the camera therefore, unless you buy a external battery charger and another battery, which of course Nikon has available, you can't use the camera.The body is thin, real thin. I found it necessary to hold the camera with two hands just to avoid dropping it, not steadying it. Where the camera is designed to be held by only your right thumb and index finger is simply not enough. When you use two hands, I found myself holding my left index finger over the "POP UP" flash. Last more than one picture that way. Your point of concentration is on the screen more so than where your fingers are placed on the camera.My last Nikon purchase was a P 5100. I realize now why I love that camera. Exrernal Battery Charger. I didn't mind purchasing another battery. It has a "grip" in the body allowing you to hold it functionally with one hand. Best of all and something I really wasn't think about, it comes with a neck strape. There are two (2) strap connectors on the P 5100 and only one on the S 8000. I had a hard time holding the S 8000 on my wrist by the very thin strap supplied with the camera. I was affraid of swinging the camera into something whereby breaking it then having Nikon tell me it was my fault. Having a camera in a case on your belt is a waste of time to me. You miss pictures reaching for it and in your hast dropping the camera. I like the camera around my neck, ready!The S 8000 takes great pictures, agreed. It has more setting than I will ever use although someone else might. However, I would rather spend a bit more and get some of the "accepted as norm" features that I am used to from Nikon. Built in flash, a camera I can carry around your neck, a "grip" so I can use the camera with one hand. I'm sorry Nikon but you need to ask people who use camera what they are looking for before you design it. I hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: Great Specs - Poor Performance
Reviews.Author: Markel Phelps
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Nikon S8000 through another retailer in the hopes of utilizing a more compact camera system for an upcoming family vacation.  I currently have a Pentax K-7 camera system with three lenses and love it.  However, as great as a the K-7 is, it is a little impractical to use when going to an amusement park with the family. Thus it seemed that the Nikon S8000 would be a perfect solution to take great snapshots of our family vacation in Florida.Thankfully, I did a good going over with this camera, testing its capabilities and picture quality, using various settings and situations.  What I found was that the Nikon name doesn't mean squat when it comes to compact digital cameras.  I was somewhat skiddish with this camera to begin with, as it touts a robust 14 megapixel imaging sensor, a CCD sensor, which can only lead to a sure problem - digital noise. I guess I was hoping Nikon had developed a CCD sensor that could compensate for the noise problem, like that of the Fujifilm EXR technology digital cameras that have just recently come out.  But to my disappointment, it was to no avail.  But, to further complicate matters, the camera as been programed by Nikon engineers to do a lot of heavey noise suppresion, but that in turn causes the pictures to lose quite a bit of detail.  This really rears its ugly head when you may want to crop a picture taken with the Nikon S8000.  The noise compensation programing done with this camera causes many of the pictures to come out with mushy details.  Yes, if you use the lower ISO settings this can be reduced somewhat, but not very well.  To compound matters, if you choose to crop any of the pictures taken with this camera, the noise and mush become that much more magnified.Don't get me wrong, there a some things to like about this camera.  The 921k LCD screen for viewing and composing your pictures is wonderful.  The 10X Nikkor lens (30-300mm# is great for taking picture without the hassle of changing lenses everytime you turnaround.  The playback and editing of images taken on this camera works seemlessly. Even the tackful feel of the rubberized grip area was a nice touch. But if a well designed camera can't pass muster in the image quality department, what do you really have in a camera?  Survey says... Nothing!Since I have now returned the Nikon S8000, I am now trying out two other recent entries that seem to be a little more promising: The Sony HX5v and the Casio EX-FH100).  Neither one of these cameras use a CCD sensor for capturing images, but rather, a CMOS type sensors which helps, but does not totally eliminate, the digital noise issue that has long plagued the point and shoot compact camera market.  I am not trying to be overly critical of Nikon, because they are, no doubt, a leader in the digital SLR market, but work needs to be done to make the Nikon S8000 camera a worthy travel companion camera.

Reviews.Title: Great so far, but I'll surely update as time goes by
Reviews.Author: S. Bullock "SHB"
Reviews.Content: I've only had a few hours, but I learned something.  You can charge it by USB cable with your computer, specifically, laptop.  I was quite pleased by that.  I'll update more as I use it more.Very happy in general.  The Lowe Pro Santiago 20 works well with this camera.  It fits one extra battery.  Lowepro Santiago 20 Camera Case (Black)

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera, No Longer Nikon Customer!
Reviews.Author: Lois Suh
Reviews.Content: Prior to this camera, I had a canon digital camera. I figured, I'll spend a bit more and get this camera for better quality pictures.When it worked, it performed well. It took some great quality pictures of both objects and people. Then, 10 months later it stopped holding a charge. A few weeks later, it stopped working completely. I ordered new batteries and it still wouldn't work. I called Nikon and they said they would fix it for $125. REALLY?!?!? I really have to pay $125 after I spent $280 for the camera? I will never purchase a Nikon camera again nor will I recommend one to anybody looking to buy a camera.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Bandit
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this item to anyone. It lasted less than three months before it began to fail and finally quit all together just hours before our wedding day. We had to rely on friends and disposable cameras for pictures. This camera is garbage.

Reviews.Title: Camera won't turn on!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Neal
Reviews.Content: Before buying this camera, search online for "Nikon S8000 (or almost any Nikon) won't turn on". You will find many unhappy customers. Ours stopped working after 10 months. Preparing to send it back to Nikon as I type this review. It's back to Canon for my family. Nikon, stop making 10,000 different cameras and concentrate on making just a few models work correctly.

Reviews.Title: Failed One Month after Warranty Expired
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Purchased this after reading reviews on Consumer Reports (did not purchase through Amazon, but use Amazon a lot, so want others to be informed).  While the camera worked well and the photos and videos were pretty good quality, the camera itself was very poor quality.  We started experiencing problems after about 9-10 months with it failing to power on.  Once it came on, it seemed to work fine, but after another few months, it would not power on at all.  I returned it to Nikon, who initially told me it was not under warranty so I would have to pay ~$100 for the repair.  I explained that I'd had these problems for several months, and they decided to repair it under warranty.  However, a couple of weeks later, the camera arrived at my house with a statement that it was beyond repair.  While I'm pretty unhappy with the camera, I'm more unhappy with Nikon, and they way they handled this.  Sending me my broken camera via UPS without a word or without any compensation is pretty much the worst customer service I've seen for this type of item.  I realize there are plenty of folks out there who like Nikon, but I for one would strongly recommend avoiding them.

Reviews.Title: Items included with camera purchase
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that a small user-friendly owners manual was not included in the camera packaging.  Also, this is the first time I have purchased a like camera where an AC adapter battery charger is not included.  I was very disappointed when I opened the package and realized I needed to purchase this separately.  The usb and cable system are very user unfriendly and inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: S8000 has poor mechanical reliability
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for just over a year and the lens mechanism failed in the middle of a big vacation trip in Europe. The lens makes a grinding sound in trying to open up as well as retract. It started with the lens cover leaves only partly retracting and after a couple days, complete failure. We are amatures, this camera has taken about 4000 photos. Maybe this is the life, but for us, this is too soon to have this loss. It makes it an expensive camera to use. I suspect the lens mechanism is cheap plastic that is just worn out. Anyone know if other models have more durability?Otherwise, this camera takes great photos for 80% of what we want. The main complaint is poor flash and poor low light performance.

Reviews.Title: Flash position inconvenient, but good otherwise
Reviews.Author: Dree-Dree
Reviews.Content: Our Casio Exilim EX-Z4 finally died so we purchased this one as a replacement.  On the Casio the flash is integrated (doesn't pop up) and the Nikon has a pop-up flash...right where we were used to holding the camera with our left hand.  It will take some practice to get our hand out of the way to allow the flash to pop up, and also the Nikon Coolpix is a bit larger than the Casio Exilim, but otherwise the Nikon is a good camera with excellent zoom capability (better than the Casio).

Reviews.Title: Don't get this camera if you photo your pets!
Reviews.Author: J. Ford
Reviews.Content: For some reason this camera always has a double flash.  Pictures are nice when the animals eyes are open.  Contacted Nikon tech support and they couldn't help, doesn't seem to be any way to turn it off.  The double flash causes any animal to blink and they always have their eyes closed in the pictures that are taken with a flash.  I guess the animals have a slightly quicker reaction time to the flash.  I suppose it's for red eye reduction in people.  Extremely frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Borja
Reviews.Content: Its a truely amazing camea, its great in many ways, from the wide angle of the camera, to the amazing 10x Zoom, to the numerous options it has along with the panoramic option that helps you take pictures to then on your computer connect them and make a panoramic picture!! Downfall all though, is that it does not have the view finder, when real sunny, your not able to see what your taking a picture of, but the more you use it, the more you get use to it, and know what will be in the picture, ive managed to get over it already though!!

Reviews.Title: I like it but not wowd...
Reviews.Author: obi_jedi
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera because consumer reports gave it a 'CR best buy' and Nikon is a company that I trust with cameras, with all that said I think this is a good camera but it could be better. My one huge issue is the flash! I always hold my camera with both hands and my left finger on the left corner but the pop up flash is located right there so in the middle of trying to take a picture with the flash the screen reminds me that I have to move my finger. Since I have only had it for less then a month I guess that I will get used to placing my finger in another spot. Other then that my other peeve is the paint, I dropped it once and the paint has already come off in a few spots. I'm waiting for some kind of skin to come out so that I can protect it from any other damage that may happen.Yet in all I must say that this is a great camera! The photo quality is wonderful right out the box but be sure to read the manual since there are many different features and that's the only way to know them all. So if your looking for a better then average digital camera then this would be the one that you should want.

Reviews.Title: Flash in wrong spot
Reviews.Author: capt
Reviews.Content: The pop up flash is on the top left. This is where my left hand comfortably holds the camera. This prevents the flash from opening. It's a small thing and I got used to holding it differently. The screen also tells you in big letters the flash is not open. It shots great photos and is easy to program and use. The red color makes it easy to find.

Reviews.Title: NIKON S8000 COOLPIX DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Marilyn K. Teigen
Reviews.Content: It is a very easy camera to use.  Takes very good, clear pictures and the HD video looks good and clear.One thing I don't especially like is the inconvenience of the flash popping up where I want to hold the camera on the one corner.Overall, it is a small, thin camera that I carry in my purse.  I like the size and is light in weight. The 3" viewing screen is very nice.I like my camera so well that I have purchased the same camera for Christmas for my daughter.It does take extra time to focus the camera under auto focus in certain light conditions before you take the picture or picture turns out blurry.I would recommend this camera to anyone that wants a simple, small, light, thin camera that is easy tocarry with you at all times.The Nikon S8000 is rated #1 in Consumer Reports for compact cameras.

Reviews.Title: nikoncoolpixs8000
Reviews.Author: Larry Chalfant "biglar"
Reviews.Content: My cousin bought one of these and I was so impressed I went on and line got one, too! This camera will do almost anything most amateurs want at a really affordable price!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't live up to expectations
Reviews.Author: Nelson Almonte "ecm operator"
Reviews.Content: I selected this camera because I was looking for a pocket size digital camera to replace by biggerSony DSC-V-3 which I have owned for 5 years, for travel and casual photographing.  I used this Nikon camerafor a few outdoors photos with pleasant results, but I had no such luck at a wedding of a relative this past weekend.  You cannot hold this camera like any other because the flash pops up on the upper left part and if you forget about this, that photo would be ruined.  Overall quality of indoor photos is disappointing; cannot match the quality of my older Sony which has 7.2 MP's, half of what this Nikon is supposed to have.Would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Eric F. Shippert
Reviews.Content: Picture quality isn't exactly as clear as it should be, for being NIKON. When I got the camera, the lens was defective with spots that were a part of the lens. Although you won't see it unless you look at it in the light. After a few months the picture screen and video started shaking. I sent it into a Nikon repair facility to fix the problem. They sent it back to me fixed and within a few months it started doing the same thing and worse. I do not recommend anybody to buy this piece of crap. There is NOTHING good about this camera. Needless to say I bought a Canon and JUNKED the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix 8000
Reviews.Author: kanfield1
Reviews.Content: great little digital camera. nice 10x zoom. really easy to use. would recommend you get the extra memory card. the orig. internal 32mb not enough. plus 'dial down' your pixel size if you want to store more than 8 shots. (the factory setting is set on max. pixels, which = 14mb per shot). we learned quickly when we started getting "Out of Memory" messages.

Reviews.Title: Nice HD Video
Reviews.Author: R. Luciano
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an older Canon that was 8mp.  The Nikon takes really great HD video for how small it is.  The pictures have a weird fuzziness to them, but I think thats from the skin softening function.  Havnt really gotten to use all the functions on it yet, but its def worth the price I paid.  I had to return the first one I bought from Amazon because it came defective, so Amazon quickly replaced it for me.  And that was a really smooth return process. I really like how this camera keeps a nice saturation of the colors.  Outdoor shooting during the day is very good.  But the ISO at low level lighting is not good at all.  It actually annoys me a bunch.  My Canon was great at night, but the Nikon no so much.  And for how strong the Nikon flash is, you would think the ISO level would look better.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Wilson W. Wyatt, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Of all the point-and-shoot, pocket cameras out there, this one finally delivers speed. The Coolpix S8000 replaces others we've owned...even one we bought earlier this year by another maker. It produces sharp images with good color and white balance, and, most importantly, the "lag time" is almost unrecognizable. The last point is major to us. We enjoy shooting kids, pets, and events that contain action. With just about all point-and-shoot cameras, there is an annoying lag time that frequently loses the shot we wanted. Nikon has greatly improved this quality with their new "Coolpix S8000" line of cameras. It is far superior to many others when it comes to speed, even those with big-name lenses. The lens is very good, and the features are easy to use. My primary camera is a Nikon D300 with some heavy lenses. We bought this point-and-shoot as a camera my wife could carry in her purse or I could put in my pocket, when I didn't want to lug my six-pound hunk of metal and glass (as wonderful as it is!). While it does not rival my SLR, it does what we want, and it performs very well, at a decent price. Some have remarked that the pop-up flash is in the way, depending on how one holds the camera. That just takes some getting used to how one holds it. We also love the bronze color choice...unique. Nikon Coolpix S8000 14 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Bronze)

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and Zoom...but slow to react
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Johnson
Reviews.Content: The zoom is incredible for a point and shoot camera.  It was the main reason I bought this model and it did not disappoint.  The pictures are clear as expected.  The facial recognition is good, but not perfect.  The start up time is SLOW and the time between pictures can sometimes lag a bit as if the camera doesn't understand the scene it is refocusing on.  My Canon point and shoot is faster for sure, but the zoom is far superior on the Nikon.  The HD video is the best I've taken with a point and shoot before by far.  I really enjoy this camera for what it is, but fast action I switch to my Canon (which has a Kids & Pets setting that really gets it...a setting the Nikon lacks for sure).

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera starts up fast, has minimal shutter lag, and I can take one picture right after another! It's almost like using an 35mm camera with the benefits of digital.

Reviews.Title: Best Pocket Camera Yet
Reviews.Author: nate apfelbaum
Reviews.Content: This is the best value in a combo hi rez pocket camera with HD video capability.  Just too heavy for me and the 14 megapixel still images not much different than my 10 meg Nikon that weighs half as much.  If the HD Vid is an important feature I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Happy Snapper
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: First I should mention that my husband and I each have fancy SLRs that we take on "photo shoots" so we are pretty picky about the quality of our shots.  We are very happy with this little 10X camera.  It is small enough to carry easily in my purse or in a small case on my husbands waistband.  We just used it for a visit from the grandkids and, with no fuss at all, we were snapping shots that came out clear and crisp.  That's what we bought it for and it delivered.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Roger  Smith
Reviews.Content: Started out being a great little camera....Then after owning it a few months, the left side of the LCD Screen became cloudy width vertical lines in it making it impossible to view the menu or function properly. It was still well before the warranty ended, so I sent it back to the factory. I waited three weeks and heard nothing so I phoned the Nikon repair department and was informed that I must have dropped it, therefore it wasn't covered. This was totally WRONG. I was taking a picture as this happened & I always carry it in a cushioned case. So to make a long story short....they ripped me off for $107.46 on a LCD repair that was defective!!!CANON will be my choice of cameras in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera w/ a Bad Flash Placement
Reviews.Author: Joshua White
Reviews.Content: By far, this is the best camera I've owned:  picture quality is outstanding, the large screen on the camera is wonderful, and the movies it shoots are crystal clear.  There are a couple of drawbacks though - the flash is in the worst possible location (it flips up right where you'd normally place your finger when shooting), and there is not a black & white photo option.  Still, I love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use.  It takes high quality photographs and really makes photography fun.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Norvell
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, very sleek and attractive, very small and the macro and video are awesome!!!The only downfall which doesn't even bother me is a little almost high pitched noise in the videos I take but it's really not even a problem because it's not that noticeable especially if there are other sounds in the video. The HD quality is great and the macro is seriously awesome! WORTH THE MONEY! The creative slider is a lot of fun as well, I like being able to make my pictures B/W before I even take them. The zoom is great too!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional camera
Reviews.Author: golffun "love photography"
Reviews.Content: This camera is GREAT! I have told many friends about it & one has purchased it on my recommendation. It has many of the features of my more expensive, complex camera.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pics, problematic flash mechanics
Reviews.Author: S. M. Hammontree
Reviews.Content: I took this camera overseas and came back with some beautiful pictures of the outdoors. My inside shots are all worthless, unfortunately. Not sure why this camera couldn't take low lighting shots. And the flash that pops up from the side (where my fingers naturally want to be) stopped popping up. Geek Squad couldn't fix it and offered me a new camera. I took the chance to pick out a different camera.

Reviews.Title: len error within 3 months.
Reviews.Author: yesterday
Reviews.Content: I had this Nikon Coolpix S8000 since May, 2010.  It is a nice camera to use. However, after 3 months of occasional usage, its len stuck and showed an error message for no reason.  I packed and paid shipping to send it to Nikon service for repair.  Two weeks later, I got a letter from Nikon to inform me that this repair is not covered under warranty because it was impact damage, which I never have any knowledge of.  The total repair cost is more than $100. No more Nikon product for me.

Reviews.Title: Candid Camera
Reviews.Author: Dkav
Reviews.Content: I bought this right when it came out at best buy. This camera does take some time getting used to. For ex. you need to hold the shutter button down for a little bit so the camera can process autofocus and only then take the picture. If you don't do this your photos will turn out blurry and bland. Also turning off some of the effects and playing around with that will help you with making the photo look better. Once you figure out the adjustments and how to use this camera, in my opinion its the best point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: broke within 6 months-lens error
Reviews.Author: Rosalind Capps
Reviews.Content: enjoyed using this camera for 6 months and then received a lens error-the lens would not open.  contacted amazon but never received a response from the company.  very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: do not buy it!
Reviews.Author: aherly
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera in June and is already broken! the camera is not responding. i have to send it to Nikon for repairs; and by the way was made in China

Reviews.Title: too late to return it
Reviews.Author: Jackie N
Reviews.Content: It is my fault for not trying the camera when i got it, but this camera is not working properly or at least not out of the box. my husband and i needed a camera for a coming vacation / wedding so we purchased this coolpix s8000. We got it and did not really use it. this past Halloween we took the camera to take pictures of costumes of people on the street and sadly out of bunch of pictures we took maybe five were not blurry.my next camera will be from a real store (bestbuy, walmar) and will be a point and shoot camera that won't cost more than 150 including 8.38 tax!

Reviews.Title: Not exactly what Nikon says it is.
Reviews.Author: C. Snider "thejudgemeister"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera having read several reviews.  I knew the flash was in a bad position and thought I could contend with that.  It was more of a pain than I anticipated.  I figured that the HD video noise people were describing would have been a malfunction in the camera that they received.  I did not experience the noise that several people described but I did notice a clicking sound on playback.  The sound was created when the zoom was used during recording.  I exchanged the camera for another one thinking it may have been a malfunction in that camera... the replacement did the same thing.  The clicking is loud enough that it really distracts and in some cases covers up sound from the subject your recording.  When you don't use the zoom, the video is great.  I contacted Nikon and they provided me with a quote from the owner's manual...""This is not a malfunction.As stated in your User's Manual, "The sounds of zoom control operation, autofocus lens drive movement and vibration reductions were recorded.""They know about this and put it the manual but not in the specs or on the packaging.  You don't know about it until after you've made the purchase or read it online.  I am so over Nikon for a while.  I will be returning the second one and looking into other options.  It is a shame because the camera takes great pictures and is small enough to carry in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: new digital camera
Reviews.Author: Harrison Ragsdale
Reviews.Content: Light,  extremely portable, great optics, image stabilization, red!  My wife loves it and that is a great plus!

Reviews.Title: Terrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon S8000 thinking that Nikon always delivers good picture quality. I am an avid amateur photographer, and own several Nikon DSLRs which I think are outstanding. Unfortunately, with the S8000 my trust was misplaced. While the camera is sleek with excellent shooting performance, the quality of the images was simply terrible. Even in good outdoor lighting at ISO 100 there is smudging and loss of detail when zooming in to 100%. All the pictures look as if they're slightly out of focus, and this did not change despite adjusting autofocus settings, anti-vibration settings ets. The quality of indoor shots was even worse. I used this camera for 2 months, and tried every possible setting to fix the image quality. Video quality is excellent, but there is a nagging high pitch sound in all of the footage. If you care about image quality do not buy this camera. I'm selling mine at a loss.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: F. Shaughnessy "FGS"
Reviews.Content: I keep charging batteries to replace so it will work. Almost 80% of the time it turns itself off anyway. How does this company sell such an inferior product. I feel like I was really dumb to buy it in the first place.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Laura Forgey
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  I actually bought my first one almost 4 years ago - knocked it off the counter and broke the housing - still worked beautiful until the battery cover came off.  Nikon wanted around 350 to  fix - which I would have done if I had not found this deal.  I know Nikon has a newer camera out to replace this - but this is a awesome camera.  takes beautiful pictures.  Incredible quality.  I will certainly use this until I wear out.

Reviews.Title: I'm Letting the Rating Speak for Itself
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: fantastic camera. I'm not really into writing the product reviews so adding this filler to satisfy the required number of works.

Reviews.Title: Compact and highly functional.
Reviews.Author: Steve "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I still need to explore the features on this little jewel.  I am not a camera buff.  However, it will get the job done for 99% of the people and 100% of the time for me.  GLC (great little camera).

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly K
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a while now, and it takes BEAUTIFUL pictures! the zoom is very nice, but once passing the 2x zone, it's all digital, so gets blurry.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: jackie d
Reviews.Content: Small, easy, great photos... exactly what I wanted in a digital camera. My only complaint... and I have come to deal with this... is that the flash just happens to be where I am comfortable resting my finger. When the flash needs to go up, my finger was on it. But I have broken my bad habit. Now we're fine.

Reviews.Title: present
Reviews.Author: V. Crotty "velcro"
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old granddaughter wanted a camera for Christmas.  She got this one and loves it.  A perfect present for her.

Reviews.Title: wonderful little camera
Reviews.Author: Bernard Gripp
Reviews.Content: Love this pocket camera. Great focal range and easily carried in a jacket pocket while ridingy Harley thru the Smokey Mountains. Great battery life. Got camera wet once. Put in sock with rice after removing batter and memory card.camera came back an still working as good as befoe

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Gustafson
Reviews.Content: My old  S8000 died after heavy use. I bought a newer model Nikon Coolpix but it was not as satisfactory--too slow, especially slow focusing . So I had to search for another S8000, too bad they have discontinued it.

Reviews.Title: I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
Reviews.Author: querida
Reviews.Content: Good photos, easy to use, and plenty of pre-set scenes to make life easy.  Its taken a lot of love and use from me and I have grown very attached to mine.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, when it works
Reviews.Author: Sheldon Zaklow
Reviews.Content: Camera is coming up on two years old.  Already been repaired under warranty for spontaneously shutting down, frequently - except it's still doing it.  Plus, now the lens cover doesn't open, so when it goes on and opens, it takes good pictures---  but it doesn't often turn on and stay on, and sometimes when it does it doesn't matter because the lens remains covered.

Reviews.Title: started out as a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Baker
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Nikon Coolpix s8000 in June of 2010 and used it during vacations and family get together times. While out West on vacation, I tried to turn on the camera to find nothing happening. It was frustrating and the problem became speradic where at times it would turn on by pushing the button and then other times, it wouldn't. Having two batteries, I tried both batteries to find that it occurred with each battery. I finally had to return the camera to Nikon Inc for repairs with an estimate cost of $97.00. I am waiting for the camera to be returned.

Reviews.Title: Power issue
Reviews.Author: M. Choi
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the camera until the power issues started happening.  Camera wouldn't reliably turn on, and sometimes it would just turn off, even with battery fully charged.  Very frustrating when you are trying to capture a photo moment.  Nikon support told me that my memory card was incompatible -- I still had the issue with no memory card in the camera.  No confidence in Nikon support.  Will be avoiding Nikon cameras.

Reviews.Title: The joys of owning a Nikon Coolpix S8000 14MP digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda G. Kersey "Quilt Lady"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new camera, something small that would take great pictures and be a 'point and shoot'!  There are many features on this camera that I don't use, so if you are looking for extras this will not disappoint you!!  The one I decided on had a few extras like a charging cord.....  I have not been sorry that I decided on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy - Bad power button
Reviews.Author: djjeesh
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera. The power button is so bio-polar you miss photos because it just wont work. You hit the power button 5 times and nothing happens. Wait five minutes and try it again and it works. Then in the middle of taking a photo it turns off on itself. I've tried three different times with fully charged batteries. Sent it in twice and they claim the camera was fine. Not buying a nikon camera again. This problem is mentioned multiple times on their own website reviews. Give it a check.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Keri Kogel
Reviews.Content: The camera is for my mom and she absolutely loves it! She loves how even if she isn't completely still the pictures still come out clear!

Reviews.Title: Quick shipping
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: Quick shipping.  Product was as described.  The only issue was the corner of the camera was bent a little and the flash would not pop up on its on.  I bent it back with a screwdriver and it works great now.  Was a little dissapointed but not enough to contact the seller.  In all I'm glad I bought it because it takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: tested over time
Reviews.Author: lost4guam
Reviews.Content: have traveled and taken many pictures.  Auto focus is still new to me and I have learned some downfalls, like don't even think about taking pitures of fish swimming behind glass.  Also, thinks in motion and remain in motion will generally not get let you auto focus.  The camera is small and light enough to take around.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Terra
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 years ago and have used it since. It is marketed as a higher end point and shoot, but I think it is more than that. Well worth the money if you don't want to take on a DSLR yet. I sent it in for a tune-up due to power issues about 6mos ago and it works as good as when I first got it. Great service all around. This camera still has a lot of life in it even after 10,000 or more pictures taken. I took this camera with me on many travels, the zoom is AWESOME, captures details you don't notice in real life like faraway signs. It does make pictures "soft" looking but that is normal for Nikon. Not great in low light, gets pretty noisy. The grip is nice, I don't think your fingers get in the way of the flash so I don't know why people say this is a problem, it hasn't been for me. This is a great camera for macro, you can get up to 1" away and still focus. Build is great quality, not cheapy plastic but metal and a rubbery grip. Works and looks great after multiple drops (oops). Menu is easy and intuitive, no more than 1 level deep. This is part of the experience which some manufacturers overlook but Nikon did well here. Comes with great panorama software too that is really fun to experiment with.Basically it's a darn good camera for the price, I'd give 4 1/2 stars if I could; solid build; versatile from zoom to macro; takes nice video, etc. but minus half a star for poor flash-off low light performance, vignetting.If you're a beginner-almost-intermediate camera user like me this may as well be a DSLR minus the bulk. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Beyond disappointing!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is beyond a disappointment-a first, it would refuse to open intermittently-now, it has stopped opening or turning on altogether! Obviously, it is useless! At almost $300, this is an outrage, especially since Amazon does not accept returns after 30 days!

Reviews.Title: Cool pix camera
Reviews.Author: Hrm
Reviews.Content: I owned this camera once before and wanted another because it takes great photos. But, the one I received was clearly refurbished and pieced together. This was not in the description. The camera has trouble staying on and sometimes won't turn on when The power button is pressed. Very disappointed and a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Should have stayed with Canon
Reviews.Author: Shawn 2 Wheels
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Canon (can't recall model) that I dropped.  This Nikon has been a real disappointment.  Right off the bat the controls are very unintuitive and difficult to understand.  The self timer can be set, but it won't stay; you have to reset it every shot.  The auto focus frequently focuses on who knows what and you wind up with blurry pictures.  Overall it's an expensive camera for a point and shoot style that doesn't work very well.  Sorry I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great pics.  Issues after 12 months.
Reviews.Author: Markle Farkle "Markle Farkle"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife and it has worked like a champ until she took it on a vacation.  Unfortunately it is not under warranty so it is $100 if I want it repaired.  It got to where it would not turn on or would turn itself off in the middle of things.  Granted I don't have a second battery to see if this is the problem but it does not appear to be battery failure from what the wife tells me.

Reviews.Title: nikoncoolpix
Reviews.Author: RRoman
Reviews.Content: i received the camera on 12/18/11 it was not working, the lens cover did not closed the camera was returned with their approval on 12/19/11 as of today(1/9/12) I HAVE no answear

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Nurse Nelly
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great for about 2 years.  But all of a sudden it now says Lens Error and will turn off imediately after turning it on.  We searched the issue online and found that it is a binding mechanism.  Nikon will only let us know how much it would be to fix it if we pay shipping to send the camera in.  about a year ago we sent it in to fix the door covering the SD card and battery it was $70 it fix the external piece.

Reviews.Title: Terrible disappointment after many positive reviews
Reviews.Author: Daniel Tonsing
Reviews.Content: We picked this camera based on previous positive reviews.  Our major problem was limited and eventually non-existant battery  even after buying a new battery.  Minimal "light options," slow photography, relative bulkiness, and disappointing reaction to shadows.  Will never buy a Coolpix again!

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: suzyb1078
Reviews.Content: It has VERY little shutter lag and the pictures look great.  It is a compact camera with pictures that don't reflect what you would normally expect from a compact camera.  You would expect less.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: tennisgrandma's thoughts
Reviews.Author: bridgemaven
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in great condition and on time.  The pictures that I've taken have been of excellent quality, especially the telephoto shots.  I'd been having trouble with the poor quality of the telephoto shots from the Canon that I had been using for a number of years, which is why I finally bought a new one.  The Nikon didn't have any of the blur or out of focus on telephoto pictures that the Canon has, so I'm a very happy camper.The only quibble would be with the positioning of the pop up flash.  I knew about that feature but bought the camera anyway and I guess I'll just have to get used to positioning my hand differently.

Reviews.Title: Would have been a nice camera
Reviews.Author: Wolf
Reviews.Content: If it hadn't kept locking up. It was a nice little camera for travel. Fit easily in a pocket and took pretty decent pictures. The zoom feature was impressive for the price, but almost out of the box it would lock up after taking a few dozen pictures. Had to force it to power off and back on to reset it. Sent it back for repair and it was returned with the same problem. Finally returned it, which was too bad because I liked the camera for what it was. Nothing I would use professionally, but a nice, simple camera to have close at hand for quick use.

Reviews.Title: Good vendor and product
Reviews.Author: Alejandra Portugal
Reviews.Content: It is a nice camera however the flash has to pop up on the left side of it where you usually put your finger, so you have to get use to take it differently and the tripod space is on one side which makes difficult to leave it in the tripod. Besides these, take great pictures and video, zoom is awesome!!Vendor also great since it delivered on time and new as I requested. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Generally Unimpressed. I Expected More
Reviews.Author: D. Thorson
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge Nikon fan. Having grown up in the world of SLRs and then Digital SLRs. I'm also a huge Apple fan and have been using the iPhone for most of my "point and click" photo needs. The iPhone however does not have an optical zoom and has relatively low picture resolution. Its digital zoom is very good, but can't make up for the quality of a good optical zoom.I was hoping to achieve Nikon "professional quality" output with a camera small enough to carry in my pocket.  Its size is fine. the zoom is fine and it works great for what it is. But after weeks of using it, I've yet to get a single photo which is far and away better than what I've been able to get out of the iPhone. The iPhone is faster to shoot, easier to use, faster to zoom, has much better image firmware (as in the way it sees colors is better), has much better exposer controls - you simple touch the screen on the area you want to "expose to". The Nikon is really " you take what it tells you to take" no - manual speed or exposure controls to speak of.This Nikon has a low light compensation feature which does in fact let you take pictures in low light - I found that its interpretation of colors at low light was a bit of guessing game - you never knew what it was going to come up with. ( greens look brown, etc)My pleasant surprise on this camera was the video, which I didn't buy it for but find myself using more than ever expected - not being an video expert, I'm impressed with the quality. I'll keep the camera mostly for this reason.In short if you want reliable "good" photos, every time,  this is a great camera - but not particularly any better than an iPhone. If you want exceptional photos and want to be surprised by how beautiful the photos are - stay with a full sized  SLR for now. I love my Nikon D70 and if it weren't for the size it would be my standard for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Koolpix S8000 review
Reviews.Author: wlj2
Reviews.Content: Our Kooplix S8000 camera has met all of our expectations.  It is easy to use and it produces clear pictures of first-rate quality.  We commend this camera to anyone looking for a cost-effective way to create quality pictures in a general photography setting.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, terrible audio/video recorder
Reviews.Author: HS "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: The S8000 is compact, easy to use, and generally takes excellent pictures. The large color screen makes instant review of both pictures and video very easy and even pleasing to the eye. One of the reasons I purchased the camera was to create short, relatively high quality movie clips that can be assembled into movies.I just created a video that included short interviews of friends and am horrified at the highpitched squeal throughout the clips I recorded with the S8000. (Note: this sound is actually audible when replaying video clips on the camera itself)Other forums have pointed out that the sound is in a relatively narrow freq range that some will not notice or at least find hard to hear. However, once sensitized to it, it becomes very annoying.I would not buy this camera without making sure that this sound is either not present or not audible to you!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S8000 14.2MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Pauline Ross
Reviews.Content: I was use to big bulkier cameras so this was a total challenge & change of handling and now I love this lightweight camera. It is relatively easy to work once you learn what it can do.I have been photographing my artworks and getting great results so far. Had to adjust my handling and setting up of camera and artwork to get straight on images. I found the pictures super clear and focused at 14.2mb even while holding the camera and shooting. So this was a PLUS for such a small instrument. I am still learning the camera and all it can do. So far so good. Very convenient on the run as well. Not good for driveby and shoot. And that is because it is too small to control with one hand and drive at the same time! lol Heavier camera works better there. I know I shouldn't be doing that but sometimes its one in a million. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for lightweight high megapixel capability and wants really good quality imaging without spending a fortune on fancier options.

Reviews.Title: CoolPix S8000--WOW!
Reviews.Author: Laurel Girl
Reviews.Content: I have a Nkion D-40 SLR and loved it--until I got my coolpix.  I bought it just before a trip to San Antonio and charged it the night before (glad I did that!) I took the info book with me because I am not camera-literate.  I used the quick start up guide and I was on my way!  VERY easy to use and the pictures are outstanding.  I loved the zoom and could stand across the street from one of the San Antonio missions and get great close-ups of the detail in the architecture.  This cammera slips into your pocket--in my case, my jeans pocket--and you don't have to look like a tourist (just get rid of the street map, and you are good to go).  The pictures are crisp, clear and after you take them, you can zoom in on them and capture a closer image--too cool!.  I have always had a viewfinder and thought I would miss it, but I haven't at all.  This camera shoots when you push the button--like my SLR--and you can adjust for low light. I am going to get rid of my SLR--no need to carry that around my neck--bulky & heavy- when I can do the same with my S8000.  I am going to get my teenager an L22 for Christmas.  It takes AA batteries, and at $89  what a great gift!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Constance
Reviews.Content: I have a nice Kodak with great lense - but by the time I got it focused correctly the subject always moved and I lost my picture.  I needed and got with the S8000 a camera that is giving me great resolution when I grab it and take a shot.  Better yet, with my need to wear 'readers' now, my eyesight was an issue with the other viewfinder - the S8000 has given me back my love of photography.  I have experimented with several of the options and have captured wildlife at dusk without a flash, changed the pixels for greater resolution, it's been very easy to learn to use.  I have taken limited videos, none I would share with anyone - but I think it's more my learning curve now then an issue with the camera.  Bottom line, I went to Consumer Reports and this was the camera that seemed to best meet my needs and I have found no faults with it - I got everything I wanted !

Reviews.Title: Coolpix 8000 lives up to name
Reviews.Author: S. gannaway
Reviews.Content: the camera is rated number one by consumer reports and they were right. it is easy to use and takes great pictures. plus the 10x zoom is amazing.

Reviews.Title: The Good The Bad The Ugly
Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: The Good: 14.2Megapixels; 10x zoom (best in class), 3.0-inch VGA (921k-dot--best in class); great picture and color; long video recording; can also be charged through PC, phone charger via USB cable; come with a small camera bag.The Bad: Often hard to press down shutter when using autofocus feature therefore missing lots of precious moments; Flashlight pops up often gets blocked by finger holding the camera; take a few seconds after powered on; battery can only be charged when in camera. Some small details were not well thought out, for example, the rubber tag covering USB port is so difficult to peel off, the wrist stripe can certainly benefit from an extra plastic clip to prevent slipping (like the design cannon uses).The Ugly: Too thick--very inconvenient to carry in the pocket; the mini USB is Nikon specific just a tad smaller than the generic mini-USB (what a shame that Nikon engineers made this non-environment friendly decision--and believe me it's a pain to track and keep the cable when traveling if you also carry other USB cables); Very slow (takes minutes) for a PC to recognize pictures after connected through USB (without installing Nikon software).What can I say--love it and hate it. It takes great pictures but so many little things are plainly annoying.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, yet not what I had hoped for
Reviews.Author: M. Emmerich "M Emmerich"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday last month and wanted something with a zoom that would be comperable to my SLR.  I found it in this little camera.  I wanted the ease of a point and shoot with some capabilities of the zoom of my SLR.  I have a Pentax *ist D that I've had for almost 5 yrs now and I love it....but it's sometimes not so easy to haul around on trips and things.  This camera does really great shots IF you know what you're doing.  There are so many settings that it takes a little getting used to!  It's not a difficult camera to work, but the settings weren't what I was used to.  It's not so great at low light pictures with much movement (i.e. I shoot alot of bands in bars & concerts) it has alot of noise and distortion, but for good light it does great pictures.  Outdoors or indoors it does a great job!The video is good quality.  I've been so used to my older video camera with the shaking while shooting that it was a nice surprise when it had the video stability.  People see the videos and say 'Wow! You've got a pretty steady hand!' then I have to laugh!  I've done some videos with my kids' school concerts and things, they seem to turn out really well.All in all, this is a good little camera....but don't be fooled with it's high speed manual zoom....it's not the same as an SLR, but it will work for those occassions I need to pull it out from my purse!  I read the reviews before buying and there are also a few things I would like to note...  The shadows in all of the pictures that people keep talking about, I don't understand.  I have YET to see that in any of my pics!  The flash is DEFINITELY in the wrong spot!  Although I just push it back in when I don't want a flash anyway.  They should have made it a stationary flash instead of pop-up.  There are plenty of things that make this camera worth the price! The 14 MP photos make it easy to crop/zoom without distortions...so what you can't do with the camera, you can with the editing. It's worth the $$.  I had to see for myself...maybe you should too!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Colorado Gator
Reviews.Content: 10x zoom was the reason we purchased this camera.  Our old 3x zoom Canon just didn't do the job.  We are very pleased with the zoom and shutter response speed.

Reviews.Title: Xtremely Satisfying Nikon Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Jon P.
Reviews.Content: I received my Nikon Coolpix S8000 in a timely manner, and I have been very pleased with its picture and video quality ever since. The camera has built in memory, but I also needed to purchase a memory card. The instruction manual has a list of brands and types of memory sticks capadable for this camera. Only problem I've had was finding a case for it. The regular S-series Nikon leather cases do not fit this product, but I found this leather case on AMAZON.com: USA GEAR Protective Digital Camera Case with Magnetic Clasp and Wrist Strap for Nikon Coolpix L20 / S570 / S8000 / S630 - Includes Microfiber Cleaning. The camera fits like a glove with this product, but after some use the leather will break in and be easier to use. Another great feature of this camera is the 3 in. LCD screen. I was at a football game and I was at one end-zone and I was able to zoom all the way in and watch the game at the other end of the field in perfect picture clarity. It was like watching a small HD television! Battery life is also amazing!

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8000
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the ease of use of this camera.The images are sharp and clear.  You can use manual settings but for the most part I find that the automatic settings seam to handle most situations on its own.The wide angle lens is great for scenery shots that I have taken.  The zoom is incredible for a camea of this size.  I would reccomend this for anyone who wants a great compact camera.  I'm still playing with the video mode.  I tried using it at a concert but the light conditions did not seem veem very compatable with the camera.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: draftmaster
Reviews.Content: This is one good camera.  Very easy to to use.  I think the picture quality is excellent and video quality is equally as good.  If you need a camera for a vacation that will do everything you need from sunset to sunrise pictures, to portraits, to quick pics while moving and is small enough to fit in your pocket this is your camera.  I recently return from a European vacation and bought his camera just for the trip and I was not dissappointed, it was great.  I took over a 1,000 pictures and movies (HD movies)and was brutal sometimes on the camera and it performed great.  The battery lasted and the ease of changing settings for different situations was great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Low
Reviews.Content: Great pictures.  Excellent optical zoom.  Video is good, but not ideal for that function.  Camera is slightly larger than my previous compact camera, but worth the larger size to get the great zoom feature.  Wish you could view pictures without the lens being open.

Reviews.Title: great camera easy to use
Reviews.Author: A. Cooksey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a trip with my mom and sister so they could take pictures with the push of a button. I picked the right one it is easy to use takes great photos almost as good as my Cannon Rebel XSI. The videos are amazingly clear.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: bayrunr
Reviews.Content: Got this camera right before our last vacation and used it right out of the box with no problems.  Have only used it for basic point and shoot - haven't used any of the special features like sports burst, but basic point and shoot gives great, clear pictures.  Took great pics without even reading the manual.  Will have to read the manual to learn more to take advantage of some of the other features - just haven't had time yet.Was looking for a 12x optical zoom but ultimately chose this camera with the 10x zoom because of its portability.  It has a slim design that can fit in your pocket.  Figured I'd have it with me more often to capture great pics than if I purchased a larger camera with larger lens.Bottom line - easy to use, easy to carry and great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8000 - Great compact digital
Reviews.Author: Frances J. Porgal "fjpor"
Reviews.Content: So far all of the uses I have put this little camera through have been very satisfactory.  Photos come out bright, clear and picture-true - video I have not used very much but the little I did appeared to be pretty good.  Handy viewing when hooked up to LED TV with HDMI connection.  The size and weight of the camera is really nice.  Pretty much satisfies all for which I need a camera - photos, some video and emailing same to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: Bee
Reviews.Content: Good camera, but flash is hiding on top right corner so u might not be able keep ur fingure there apart from that it's a great camera  in all respects I bought 2 both work great

Reviews.Title: Too bad these are not being made anymore!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera from Nikon.  This is my first Nikon, but I am already loving it.  It has so many features and is so compact that I can take it along anywhere.  That is really what's important to me, that and the fact that it has a 10X optical zoom.  Optical zoom is a big determining factor for me when buying a camera.Two thumbs way up!

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: hrfaulkner
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my boyfriend's birthday and he absolutely loves it. He has remarked severl times of how well the photos turn out and the different functions the camera has to offer. He said it does a lot better than he thought it would.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix s8000
Reviews.Author: J. Schultz "Tikijon"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, and the price made it even nicer. I'm going back to Asia where last time I lugged around a Nikon D40 with gear! This little baby takes great 14.2 megapixel shots, with zoom, and fits in your vest pocket!!  Love it !!!

Reviews.Title: A Great Walking-Around Camera
Reviews.Author: Anita M. Wilson "Snekrqueen"
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur digital SLR photographer, but I don't like to keep my "big" camera in my car. So I wanted a point & shoot camera to have for those spontaneous photo opportunities, as well as vacations and other times an SLR isn't convenient to carry. I shot video recently with my Nikon Coolpix and was amazed at the clarity and true color rendition. Incidentally, this was my first attempt at video recording with ANY camera, and I found it to be relatively easy. I also like the rechargeable lithium battery. A review by Cnet almost dissuaded me from purchasing it, reporting that the camera's workmanship was lacking. I found the Coolpix to be a big camera in a little body, and I'm very glad I purchased it. No regrets!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera!
Reviews.Author: KHW
Reviews.Content: The immediate reason (excuse!) for my buying this camera was a trip with my son to Spain and Poland, but I will be using it to take yearbook pictures at my school as well. So far, I have found this camera to be absolutely terrific. It is light, small, and very easy to use. The cord that one uses to recharge it is also the cord one uses to transfer pictures to the computer, and I've barely had to read the booklet at all! There are lots of options, which is great, and even though I've just been doing the basics so far, I know there's so much can learn to do if I choose. The quality of the pictures AND the videos is great, as is the sound on the videos. And now, the memories of a summer trip to Europe that will stay in my heart forever are memories I can share and relive through my beautiful pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Debbi
Reviews.Content: I have an old digital camera that has driven me crazy ever since I received it to replace my point and shoot 35 mm.  It was time to replace it!The Nikon Coolpix S8000 is just what I was looking for.  It satisfies my 2 biggest problems with my old camera:1) It has a great zoom.  I'm a mom of 2 athletic teenagers.  You can actually recognize my kids in the pictures I take from the sidelines.  No more "take my word for it - he's one of the guys out there".2) With the "Sports Continuous" feature, I don't miss the action.  You can take a bunch of pictures in a row by holding down the button.  It's great!I've had the camera for about 3 weeks.  I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best digicam
Reviews.Author: Parker Hallam
Reviews.Content: A wonder digicam. Even a novice can become an expert with such details on the menu. If you have a passion for photography this a never-miss cam.

Reviews.Title: Nikon s8000 provided fantastic photos on my vacation
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this camera.  I am not a pro photographer, but I have always liked keeping video records and this camera has been great.  The picture quality is fantastic.  I can't think of any complaints about this camera.

Reviews.Title: so far so good...
Reviews.Author: Andrea Nava "luvdrea"
Reviews.Content: I've barely had this camera a month, but so far I do like it. It takes some quality pictures, which I admit I have to run around the settings a bit to get the best for what I want. I don't rely on the Auto, it usually doesn't give me the kind of picture I'm looking for. I've taken a couple videos, during the day and night. The day quality is amazing. The night... it's okay, I can still make out what everything is for the most part. My only issue with that is when I playback the video on the camera, the audio is EXTREMELY low. But as soon as I upload the video onto my laptop it's loud. Not sure if that's a camera flaw exactly. Other than that, I enjoy using this camera, take it on vacations, concerts and just nights out.

Reviews.Title: Soooooooooo Impressed!!!
Reviews.Author: Teen Aspiring  Photographer
Reviews.Content: This camera is truly AMAZING! The picure quality is phenomenal, as well as the HD video. Only drawback is its taking me a few days to figure out all of the features because there's so many! This camera is very versatile and i think a great value! I ended up having to order from [...] because they couldnt ship it any time soon here, plus NewEgg had it for a much cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: Very good picture quality but the video is really bad...
Reviews.Author: Morgan
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good, but no better than my old Nikon E4500 from 2003.  There is no shutter priority or aperture priority, pretty much everything is in auto mode.  That is really OK by me.  But the real deal breaker is the video.  It is shocking bad that it is totally unacceptable - lots of jerky motion.  It is hard to believe it is that bad and yet Nikon let this slide.  I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Honest Abe
Reviews.Content: Features on this camera is just what I was looking for in an automatic camera. Great display and pictures are the best.

Reviews.Title: S8000 Cool Pix Rocks
Reviews.Author: kelerin
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to make this purchase for an upcoming vacation.  The camera is easy to use (even for Man thumbs) and the photo quality is awesome.  It's quite durable as well because a well meaning fellow vacationer who decided to take of group photo for us, dropped it on the ground and it is still working great.Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: S8000 review
Reviews.Author: Sanj
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I bought it to take with me on safari to Kenya. The picture quality and the 10X zoom were very good. I have not used the video function yet.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Constable
Reviews.Content: Haven't taken a whole lot of pictures with this camera, but the ones I have are GREAT!  It is quick.  The photos are great - nice color and contrast, and GREAT resolution! The 10X zoom is a wonderful capability.  The LCD viewer if marvelous.  You can use if to do some enlarging and cropping before the pics even leave the camera!  Of course, it DOESN'T do well in bright sunlight - true for all LCD displays.  The only solution is a viewfinder, which is very rare in these small cameras - and even the one I have in my Canon EOS 10D doesn't do all that well in bright sunlight.  Have taken one little video with it, and it's pretty impressive - got in close to some bubbles in a champagne glass, and they show up just fine.  It does capture audio, though not smashingly, as one would expect from a small unit with a pinhole for a microphone.  This will become pretty much my primary camera, until I can afford a Canon EOS 5D MkII.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Ronald Newman
Reviews.Content: I have resisted the purchase of any digital camera until the S8000 became available.  With the features and pricing of this camera you have the perfect blend of size, versitility and capability in a very intuitive electronics unit.  Treat yourself to the joy you will experience with this camera.I can't imagine anyone being disapointed with this Nikon digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Kroeppel
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to test it at home, and to take the camera on vacation.  Easy to use and the 10x optical zoom is amazing.  Great photos. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Basic POint a Shoot Camera with a Big Wide Zoom and a Small size. It will be perfect!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lila
Reviews.Content: If You are looking for a great point and shoot camera this is it. I have been able to take amazing shots of my kids in action with one hand. I would suggest this camera for any average joe who wants to just get photos or videos. The video is great. I recorded the 4th of July fireworks on it and they turned out beautiful. all around great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Don W. Darnell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago and absolutely love it. It is smaller and more compact than the Canon A560 I have been using for the past few years. I wanted something small enough to fit in my pocket and easy enough to get out. The 14.2 meg/pix photo quality is fantastic. The 3 inch LCD screen is exceptional. 10x zoom brings in far away subjects and the Macro is mind blowing. It will focus on things 1cm (0.4 inches) from the end of the lens. WOW! This is a great little camera that packs a lot of great features.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: TNVOL
Reviews.Content: Camera is conveniently sized for carrying on activities. Picture and video quality are excellent. Charging cord doubles as UBS cable for transferring pics to computer. Quick refresh rate for multiple pics. Good price.

Reviews.Title: LOVE ITTTTTT
Reviews.Author: Leslie B. Lyke
Reviews.Content: Awesome photos awesome video and its eas to use any one could figure it out

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera fo travelling and vacationing
Reviews.Author: Enico
Reviews.Content: This is a very slick digital camera for the price. I used it during my Hawaii vacation and all the pictures and video clips turn out very good. The camera is easy to use. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: S8000 No Nikon NO
Reviews.Author: Goldy
Reviews.Content: Owning several Nikons in the past and using them with great success, I felt resonably sure that the S8000 would solve or exceed my current picture needs. Well it might if I was happy with the camera. Remember, I am aiming at the camera itself not the pictures. I'll get to the pictures later.First of all, I went through two S8000 before the third one came from Amazon and charged the battery. When the thrid camera came, I call Nikon, directly. I had them walk me through the process of everything from opening the box to plugging in the charger. I found that I had completed the task correctly, as the instruction book stated, twice before. When the third camera came and the battery was charging, I realized I didn't do enough homework. You  charge the battery in the camera unless you purchcase an additional external battery charger. Realize that if you don't have an external battery charger for an additional battery you can't use the camera.I like to be able to hold the camera with one hand. The S8000 is too thin, at least for me, to hold comfortably. There is a small thumb pad in the upper right corner of the body for your thumb and your right index finger holds the camera in front. My right hand shape was not what Nikon used as a guide when making the plans for the S8000.  It felt very uncomfortable holding it with just the right hand. Most of the time I used my left hand as well. I guess most of us put our left thumb under the camera and the left index finger on top. Not a good idea!! The flash is can't pop up if your finger is holding it down. Keep in mind that normally you would be holding the camera with the left hand while adjusting settings with the right hand as the camera is designed to do. Without thinking I would just frame and push the shutter release whereby loosing the picture as the flash couldn't open.Lastly, how much more could it cost to have two connectors for a neck strape instead of one for a wrist strape? I like having the camera hanging down from my neck so I grab it quickly and have my hands free when not holding the camera. Think about walking around all day on vacation not being able to use two hands as one hand has to hold the camera unless you put it away.I will say this, "it takes great pictures." The zoom is excellent. The 3 inch screen is great. Ok, so you can't zoom the lens in the video mode. It has more setting and adjustments than I would ever need to use but after all, it is a Nikon !

Reviews.Title: Problems with the Nikon Collpix S8100
Reviews.Author: Elias Azpurua R.
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my new Nikon Coolpix S8100 Camera, but really do not understand how could Nikon place the flash of the camera in the Superior Left Corner where most people holds the camera to shut a picture. The location of the flash is the worse place it could be.

Reviews.Title: picture quality is bad
Reviews.Author: Akhilesh Aggarwal
Reviews.Content: This camera is not having picture quality that  would expect at its price range. I saw that Nikon has come up with a new model Coolpix S8100, I think you can try that one. I hope there should be a lot more improvement in picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Buy another camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen M. Judge
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in September 2010.  I spent quite some time researching cameras and settled on this one, despite the negative feedback that had been written about the camera.  Anyone who has the camera would agree that the location of the flash is poor, but I can accept that.  I learned early on (after a phone call to Nikon) that you needed to have a good quality memory card (about $40.)  That did help with the time it took for each picture or video to be saved.
