However, from the beginning the picture quality of this camera has been poor.  90% of the pictures that I take are blurred and of very poor quality.  THAT was very disappointing!  I've tried many different options/settings, but the pictures are still blurry.  Now you can hear the motor in the camera running, it gets hot, and as you look through the screen, it is also shaking and blurry.  I just spoke to Nikon and need to send it back.  They seem to think there may be a problem with the focus or auto focus.  I need to spend more money to ship it back, BUT they will pay to send it back to me free of charge when it is repaired (very generous).  Hopefully it will be repaired or they'll send me a new one.  I guess it's possible this camera is just a lemon and that could happen with any camera or brand you buy.

Reviews.Title: appears to be broken, and I have only had it less than a year.
Reviews.Author: Justice for Trayvon
Reviews.Content: When this camera worked it took great pictures; however, after taking this on holiday with me it stopped working properly.  On the close up setting the camera attempts to focus and refocus and never stops trying to take a clear picture.  The other settings are working; however, the close up setting is faulty. I'm not sure I will purchase a Nikon again since I had my Kodak easy share camera for 11 years and never had a problem with it. This one is useless in less than one year.

Reviews.Title: The Good The Bad The Ugly
Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: The Good: 14.2Megapixels; 10x zoom (best in class), 3.0-inch VGA (921k-dot--best in class); great picture and color; long video recording; can also be charged through PC, phone charger via USB cable; come with a small camera bag.The Bad: Often hard to press down shutter when using autofocus feature therefore missing lots of precious moments; Flashlight pops up often gets blocked by finger holding the camera; take a few seconds after powered on; battery can only be charged when in camera. Some small details were not well thought out, for example, the rubber tag covering USB port is so difficult to peel off, the wrist stripe can certainly benefit from an extra plastic clip to prevent slipping (like the design cannon uses).The Ugly: Too thick--very inconvenient to carry in the pocket; the mini USB is Nikon specific just a tad smaller than the generic mini-USB (what a shame that Nikon engineers made this non-environment friendly decision--and believe me it's a pain to track and keep the cable when traveling if you also carry other USB cables); Very slow (takes minutes) for a PC to recognize pictures after connected through USB (without installing Nikon software).  Just to be fair to Nikon this could be a Windows7 compatibility issue. I don't know for sure which one, Nikon or Microsoft, is to blame.What can I say--love it and hate it. It takes great pictures but so many little things are plainly annoying.

Reviews.Title: This camera is okay but...
Reviews.Content: I wanted this camera so bad that I treated myself to it a couple of months ago. I have to say that I'm kind of disappointed. First, maybe it's me but the pictures (especially indoors) don't come out that great. There aren't near as many picture settings as my little canon had and I really feel that my Canon takes much better pictures. But my biggest point of contention is where they placed the flash..it's right where you hold the camera. I can't tell you how many times the flash didn't go off because my finger was in the way. It makes you have to hold the camera in a completely awkward way and I hate that.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics, bad video quailty due to camera sounds.
Reviews.Author: C. Snider "thejudgemeister"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera having read several reviews.  I knew the flash was in a bad position and thought I could contend with that.  It was more of a pain than I anticipated.  I figured that the HD video noise people were describing would have been a malfunction in the camera that they received.  I did not experience the noise that several people described but I did notice a clicking sound on playback.  The sound was created when the zoom was used during recording.  I exchanged the camera for another one thinking it may have been a malfunction in that camera... the replacement did the same thing.  The clicking is loud enough that it really distracts and in some cases covers up sound from the subject your recording.  When you don't use the zoom, the video is great.  I contacted Nikon and they provided me with a quote from the owner's manual...""This is not a malfunction.As stated in your User's Manual, "The sounds of zoom control operation, autofocus lens drive movement and vibration reductions were recorded.""They know about this and put it the manual but not in the specs or on the packaging.  You don't know about it until after you've made the purchase or read it online.  I am so over Nikon for a while.  I will be returning the second one and looking into other options.  It is a shame because the camera takes great pictures and is small enough to carry in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Khaled A. Soliman
Reviews.Content: Nikon out performed itself again. the zoom and the quality of the pictures are outstanding. I tried the video feature, but I need to work on how to make the sound higher, I guess I will have to read the manual

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: Carlos E. Giura
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, we are not pro users. We feel it a little hevier than other in the category. And also a bit expensive point and shoot. No problem at all with the photographs.

Reviews.Title: Lemon!
Reviews.Author: Krazy4MJJ
Reviews.Content: Clearly, I got a lemon.  I can't even write a proper review of this camera because I only really used it for a few days before it wouldn't work at all.  I sent it back to Nikon and they had it for months, stating that the repair was covered under warranty.  I just got it back this week and I still cannot even turn it on.  Why on EARTH would they send it back to me without testing it first?  I called them back and they sent me a UPS label to send it back for repair.  Franky, I wish they would keep this piece of junk and just send me my money back.  I have used my Canon Digital Rebel, with no problems at all, since 2005 and I only wanted a small camera to carry with me on a trip and for the summer to take to my swim club.  The trip came and went and summer is almost over so the camera will be worthless to me now; that's if Nikon can even get it to work.  I would not recommend buying this camera!

Reviews.Title: S8000 Lens Error problem
Reviews.Author: Imaquivrn
Reviews.Content: The camera takes exceptional vivid color pics but after several months suddenly quit working with the 'lens error' display coming on. Sent it back to Nikon service and they've had it a month now, with a 'parts hold' on it, which is frustrating right before holidays. Researched other reviews and was not impressed in learning the camera has another inherent problem of turning itself off. Can't wait for them to fix it so have ordered a Canon Powershot S95. Finding that Nikon does not have a very high reputation in the consumer reports point and shoot reviews. Let you know about the Powershot in a few months.

Reviews.Title: used
Reviews.Author: S. Brown
Reviews.Content: the camera was not as advertised.it was on it's 2cd time around.it works but I would not recco to anyone.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE FROM ELECTROBRANDS
Reviews.Author: gforce2
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Electro Brands in New York.  I bought a brand new camera as shown on my invoice.  After using the camera 3 times, the cameras screen started to show streaks knows as bleeding.  Since it was past the stores return period Electro Brands suggested I sent the camera to Nikon for repair.  Nikon informed me that they could not repair the camera since it was a refurbished camera.Since I purchased the extended warranty, In July I sent it to a company called Safco, also in New York for repair.  After waiting 3 months to get my camera back, I received a camera.  It was not my camera as the serial number did not match.  In addition, the camera was broken as the automatic lens protector was inoperable and obscured the lens.I sent the camera back to Safco in October and as of the date of this writing, December 18, 2012, I still do not have my camera back.  I have followed up with them many times and asked that they have it back to me before the holidays, but to no avail.I also contacted Electro Brands to let them know that I did not receive a new camera, but rather a refurbished one.  I asked for a new camera as was shown on my receipt or I wanted my money back.  They would not do either.I'm not sure whether this is a good camera since I did not get a chance to use it enough and it was a refurb.

Reviews.Title: False and Misleading Advertisement
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I was told I was purchasing a New Nikon camera and after having issues with the camera not working we sent the camera back to Nikon.  Nikon informed us that we had been sold a refurbed camera that Nikon had sold to Electrobrands.  So we paid full price for a used camera and being told it is too late to be reimbursed due to it is past 90 days of purchasing. So don't believe everything you read from Electrobrands and Amazon.  Very disappointed !

Reviews.Title: The power of the camera
Reviews.Author: Mohsse
Reviews.Content: Good camera in photography But It's dropped from a low place  And said efficiency in imaging

Reviews.Title: don't purchase from my experience
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "you know ND"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this  camera (refurbished) and took it immediately on a trip to China. This was my first use over a 13 day period. The camera lens would not always open when it was turned on. This caused me to miss many shots. I never would know if it was going to function or not.The pictures were not any better than my 10 megapixel Kodak and I am very unhappy with the cameraI would not purchase this if I had the option to do so again. I am now left with dealing with the manufacturer for returns.

Reviews.Title: Gotta Get One!
Reviews.Author: KC "KC"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera to have when you want good, quality pictures but don't want to carry around a heavy, clunky higher quality camera.  The pictures come out great considering the small size that it is.  I take it with me everywhere as it is so small and I can depend on it to take nice pictures to send to friends.  However, if I am going on a day trip or if I am taking pictures of nature and know that is how I am spending my day, I will take the larger, better quality camera with me instead.  For the size of this little guy, it is hard to imagine that it can hold such punch!  I recommend that you "get to know it" before depending on it for quick pictures as there are so many options to get to know, though it is easy to operate once you know how to access everything.  I highly recommend this camera and am so glad that I got it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8000 Camera
Reviews.Author: Judi
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera here because it was $30 cheaper than the others.  When I got it, I discovered why... it did NOT have a memory card to save pictures on.  That was my own fault I suppose for not reading all the features, but I assumed it was like the others in the list.  I had to wait quite awhile before I could get the card so I was unable to take pictures when I thought I would.  The internal memory would not save enough pictures for my purpose.

Reviews.Title: maybe i got  a lemon
Reviews.Author: Steve M. "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I am a pro photographer and I bought this as a present for my wife . I usually shoot with nikon dslr's and the result is great. I bought this and returned it after 1 day. I don't think that it's a bad camera inherently. I can only assume that the one i got from amazon was refurbished or something because no matter what I did the picture just wasn't clear and at 14 megapixels it should be great. I won't buy cameras from amazon again.  I even tested this camera in a few diff stores and the result seemed ok. that's the problem with buying cameras online and not from a pro camera house. sorry amazon. not cool.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S8000
Reviews.Author: Nolan Vockrodt
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, fast shipping. I bought this camera from Amazon which works with other suppliers likeAdorama. They are excellent, I have bought from them before and highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: Nikon8000
Reviews.Author: Apenchin
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera.  Wife loves it. The only down side was that it came with a miniscule amount of space to record pictures.  We had to get an additional scan disc in order to capture more than a dozen shots. Wish the description had warned of the additional purchase of memory, or that the camera had come with at least 4 or 8 gigs.

Reviews.Title: its a beauty but...........
Reviews.Author: luana
Reviews.Content: Well I got this camera about a month ago and I was so excited to start using it, The color is blk but a really nice blk and it is light weight, playing with it it became easy to figure out, but when it was time to take pictures inside it just doesnt do what it says it does, but if you take pics outside your pics come out so nice like a pro took the pic. I'm just having problems with indoor pics, Ive adjusted the settings and i've added lighting but my pics just dont look like the ones i take when im outside, so i keep on one setting cause the others just dont work i guess, but in the other hand it could be me. so if anyone has any suggestions let me know.

Reviews.Author: Michael J. Klementovich "Michael Klementovich"
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable 14.2 Megapixels !!!!!!!!!Super Thin!!!!!!!!!Killer pics!!!!!!Easy to use!!!!!!!!!3 Frames per second!!!!!!!!10X's ZOOM!!!!!!!WIDE ANGLE!!!!!!!!Fantastic Nikor Lens!!!!!!What more do you want~!!!!!!??????

Reviews.Title: Amazon's little float on warrant policies.
Reviews.Author: hrnewyork
Reviews.Content: I resent the fact that my credit card was charged immediately for the warranty policy even though there will be at least one week between the order and the shipment of the camera. The warranty is useless without the camera.  They should both be charged at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Drop testing at all?
Reviews.Author: C. Jung "C J"
Reviews.Content: Great design, maybe good functions, but this camera asks you to treat it like a boss. I dropped it from 2 feet high and it says it now has 'lens error'. I sent this camera to the service center and it says the warrenty covers the "LENS ONLY" so I have to pay the rest of it. And I just got a call again from the service center and, the guy says the warranty covers SLR LENS ONLY (which is not the case here), so basically I don't have any warranty at all! So this guys now asks me to pay $100 to fix it... what more can I say?I'd like to recommend Cannon S 10 or whatever. My friend has it and he dropped it so many times, but it still works great.Yes, its my fault that I dropped it but I do really wonder if the engineers at NIKON get paid for drop testing.
